origination.corpname: University of Michigan. Nursing History Society.

did.unittitle: Nursing History Society (University of Michigan) records 1936-2003 1956-2003
did.abstract: The Nursing History Society aims to preserve the history of nursing at the University of Michigan. Society was officially formed in 1983 with the purpose of engaging in activities directed toward the preservation of the history of nursing at the University of Michigan. Records include administrative files, meeting minutes, programs, membership materials, and reports; historical files date from 1936 and include materials on the subject of nursing history, class notes, nursing manuals, oral history tapes, and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan.

acqinfo.p: The records are the gift of the Nursing History Society (Donor no. 7051). Periodic additions are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Nursing History Society (University of Michigan) Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Nursing History Society of the University of Michigan was officially organized by Linda Strodtman in the summer of 1983, with the purpose of engaging in activities directed toward the preservation of the history at the University of Michigan. The activities of the organization include researching and recording aspects of nursing history at the University of Michigan and educating others about nursing history through the sponsoring of educational programs and the assembling of historical material. Other activities include mounting exhibits and presenting lectures on nursing history.

arrangement.p: The records have been arranged into four series: Organizational Records, 1982-1995; Historical Files, 1936-1990; Collected Material, 1956-2002; and Audio-Visual Material, 1966-2003.

scopecontent.p: The records for the Nursing History Society consist of administrative records, including minutes, programs, membership materials, and reports; historical files dating back to 1936, collected material on the subject of nursing history, University of Michigan nursing class notes, nursing manuals, oral history tapes, and photographs.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Nursing--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Nursing History Society.
University of Michigan. School of Nursing.

scopecontent.p: The Organizational Records series, 1983 to 1995, (0.25 linear feet) is comprised of the administrative files of the Society itself. Among materials included are annual reports, meeting minutes and agendas, correspondence regarding Society-sponsored programming and the donation of materials, officer lists, program announcements and treasurer's reports.

did.unittitle: Centennial Calendar, "A Century of Leadership: Nursing at the University of Michigan, 1891-1991"

scopecontent.p: The Historical Files series, 1936 to 1990, (1.5 linear feet) contains materials pertaining to the history of nursing, collected by the Society. Excepting one folder of issues of the Cadet Nurse Corps News published by the U.S. Public Health Service Division of Nurse Education, and one unidentified photocopy of a letter from 1889 describing war-time nursing conditions, all of these materials relate to the teaching and practice of nursing at the University of Michigan. The bulk of the series is comprised of class notes and instructional materials dating from 1936 to 1962. In cases in which the professor or student of the class who owned the materials is known, her name has been included in parentheses in the box list below. Also of interest in this series are several nursing handbooks and manuals for use by nurses at the University of Michigan hospital.

did.unittitle: M.S. Core Courses (includes syllabi & faculty meeting materials), 1986-1990
Nursing Intervention in the Care of the Adult/N431, 1972 miscellaneous, undated
Manual of Diagnostic Procedures for Nursing, 1968

scopecontent.p: The Collected Material series, 1956 to 2002, (0.5 linear feet) is the result of the Society's accumulation of documents from a number of different sources. The series is arranged in subseries according to the material's original owner and/or creator. Karen Wolters Dutil was a nursing student at the University of Michigan in the late 1950s. This subseries includes original correspondence to her parents while she was in school as well as Dutil's own annotated transcription of the letters ("Long Ago and Far Away: Letters from Ann Arbor"). These provide a detailed view of life as a nursing student in those days, from classes to work in the hospitals to dating. The Kathleen Fischer subseries is comprised of historically valuable documents from the late 1960s and 1970s. Fischer has served as the Director of Educational Services for Nursing since 1981. Within this subseries, Topical Files include documents on the development of the Clinical Nurse Specialist Program the decentralization of nursing, the role of Physician's Assistants, and other issues that had a lasting impact on Michigan nursing. Additionally, the Fischer series contains papers that Fischer in turn had acquired from Marjorie Jackson, Director of Nursing at the University of Michigan Hospitals in the 1970s. Particularly important in these records is the Miscellaneous file, a set of diverse papers that Jackson or Fischer apparently grouped together because of the documents' seminal importance for the profession of nursing. Norma Osborn, a 1973 graduate of the university's nursing program, had a strong interest in international nursing. This subseries documents some of her work in India and Saudi Arabia in addition to her career in the Boston area. Also of interest is Osborn's mother's packing list for the Army Nurse Corps during World War II.

did.unittitle: "Long Ago and Far Away: Letters from Ann Arbor," 1994 (includes electronic copy on 3 1/2" floppy disk)
Clinical Nurse Specialist Program and expanded practice , 1970-1975
Rhoda Russell patient report (Dean of the School of Nursing), 1979
Marjorie Jackson (Director of Nursing, University Hospital) files, 1970-1979
Annual Report, Office of the Chief of Nursing (1976/77 report and background materials for earlier reports), 1974-1977
Army Nurse Corps packing list: World War II, undated

scopecontent.p: The Audio-Visual Material series, 1966 to 2003, (5.75 linear feet) includes both photographs and audio and video cassettes. Photographs depict hospital nursing staff dated 1978-1984, and the 1984 attendants of the Gordon Research Center Proctor Academy in Laconia, New Hampshire. The cassettes have been artificially arranged by the processor in an attempt to group recordings in a more meaningful way. Creating oral histories was an ongoing project of the Society, and these recordings constitute the first subseries. Another subseries, University of Michigan Nursing, documents events either at the School of Nursing or within the University Hospital system. A large part of the Educational subseries represents materials that had once been held at the Educational Services for Nursing. These recordings are often general to the practice of nursing, but were produced by the university. The Lectures/Panels subseries documents such events sponsored by the school or hospital generally relating to broader issues in the field of nursing.
